description: Automated AI education blog + content pipeline for joestechsolutions.com

userStories.title: Blog Content Model & Types
userStories.description: As a developer, I need TypeScript types and content schema so all blog components share consistent data structures.
acceptanceCriteria: Create `src/lib/blog/types.ts` with Post, Pillar, ContentType interfaces
Define frontmatter schema: title, date, type (guide/article), pillar, excerpt, featured, featuredImage, tags, draft
Create `src/lib/blog/pillars.ts` with pillar definitions (slug, name, color, description)

userStories.title: MDX Content Loader
userStories.description: As a developer, I need functions to load and parse MDX files so pages can fetch blog content.
acceptanceCriteria: Parse frontmatter from MDX files in `content/blog/guides/` and `content/blog/articles/`
Compute reading time from content length
Sort posts by date descending by default
Filter out `draft: true` posts in production

userStories.title: Sample Content Files
userStories.description: As a developer, I need sample MDX files so I can test the blog UI during development.
acceptanceCriteria: Each file has complete frontmatter matching schema
userStories.notes: Foundation - depends on US-F01 for schema

userStories.title: Article Ingestion (Trafilatura)
userStories.description: As Joe, I want to ingest web articles so I can transform news/blog posts into content.

userStories.title: Channel/Feed Batch Ingestion
userStories.description: As Joe, I want to ingest all new content from my approved sources automatically.
acceptanceCriteria: `python main.py ingest` (no URL) processes all sources in `sources.yaml`
For YouTube channels: fetches latest N videos not yet processed
For RSS feeds: fetches latest N articles not yet processed
`--limit N` flag to control how many items per source
Summary output: 'Ingested 3 new items, skipped 5 existing'

userStories.title: Blog Content Transformation
userStories.description: As Joe, I want AI to transform source content into original blog posts.
acceptanceCriteria: Generates: title options, outline, full draft, key takeaways

userStories.title: Social Content Generation

userStories.title: Google Docs Draft Creation
userStories.description: As Joe, I want drafts created in Google Docs so I can review and edit before publishing.

Doc includes: blog content, IG content, TikTok script (all sections)

userStories.title: Approval Status Detection
userStories.description: As a developer, I want the system to detect when Joe approves a draft.
acceptanceCriteria: `python main.py publish --check` scans all drafted items
Reads Google Doc, checks if first line says `STATUS: APPROVED`
Lists approved docs ready for publish

userStories.title: MDX File Publishing
userStories.description: As Joe, I want approved content published as MDX files in the correct folder.
acceptanceCriteria: Extracts blog content from Google Doc
Creates MDX file with frontmatter (title, date, pillar, type, excerpt, etc.)
Saves to `content/blog/guides/` or `content/blog/articles/` based on type

userStories.title: Git Commit Automation
userStories.description: As Joe, I want published content auto-committed so it deploys automatically.
acceptanceCriteria: After MDX file created, runs `git add` + `git commit`
`--auto-push` flag to also push to remote
Never commits if MDX file is empty/invalid

userStories.title: Source Attribution Tracking
userStories.description: As Joe, I want source attribution tracked internally for my records.
acceptanceCriteria: ContentItem stores: source_url, source_type, original_title, original_author
Attribution NOT included in published MDX (per PRD non-goal)
`python main.py status --sources` lists all processed sources

userStories.title: Pipeline Run Logging
userStories.description: As Joe, I want logs of all pipeline runs so I can debug failures.
acceptanceCriteria: Log includes: timestamp, command, items processed, success/failure
`python main.py status` shows last 5 runs summary

userStories.title: Dry Run Mode
userStories.description: As Joe, I want a dry-run mode so I can preview changes without side effects.
acceptanceCriteria: Dry run: no API calls, no file writes, no git commits
Exit code 0 if dry run would succeed

userStories.title: Budget & Rate Limiting
userStories.description: As Joe, I want API budget controls so I don't accidentally overspend.
acceptanceCriteria: Tracks token usage per day in `logs/usage.json`

userStories.title: Manual Topic Injection
userStories.description: As Joe, I want to manually add topics so I'm not dependent on external sources.
acceptanceCriteria: `python main.py ingest --topic 'How to use Claude for X' --pillar prompting`
Skips ingestion, goes straight to transformation

userStories.title: Aggregated Roundup Posts
userStories.description: As Joe, I want to combine multiple sources into a single roundup post so readers get comprehensive updates on a topic.
acceptanceCriteria: `python main.py roundup --pillar news --days 7` aggregates recent sources into one post
Collects all ingested items from the specified pillar within the date range
Uses Claude to synthesize into a cohesive roundup article (not just summaries)
Generates title like 'Weekly AI News Roundup: [Date Range]'
Each source gets a section with key takeaways and link to original
Includes 'What This Means For You' synthesis section at the end
Creates single ContentItem with `source_type=roundup` and references to source items
Supports `--min-sources N` to require minimum sources (default: 3)
Skips if not enough sources in date range (logs warning)
userStories.notes: Creates weekly/monthly roundups from multiple sources

userStories.title: Roundup Prompt Templates
userStories.description: As Joe, I want dedicated prompts for roundup posts so they have consistent structure.
acceptanceCriteria: Prompt instructs Claude to: synthesize (not summarize), find themes, provide actionable insights
Template includes sections: Introduction, [Topic Sections], Key Themes, What This Means
Voice guide applied same as individual posts

userStories.title: Scheduled Roundup Generation
userStories.description: As Joe, I want roundups auto-generated on a schedule so I don't forget.
acceptanceCriteria: Config option in sources.yaml: `roundups:` section with pillar, frequency, days
Default config: twice-weekly roundups (Tuesday + Thursday) for all 4 pillars: news, local-ai, prompting, experiments
Supports multiple days per pillar: `days: [tuesday, thursday]`
`python main.py roundup --scheduled` runs all due roundups for today
Tracks last roundup date per pillar in `logs/roundups.json`
GitHub Actions workflow runs on Tues/Thurs schedule
userStories.notes: Twice-weekly (Tues/Thurs) roundups for: Tech News, Self-Hosted AI, LLMs & Prompting, Fun AI Content

userStories.title: AI Featured Image Generation
userStories.description: As Joe, I want AI-generated featured images for each blog post so the content looks professional and original.
acceptanceCriteria: Integrate Google Gemini API (Nano Banana Pro / gemini-3-pro-image-preview)
After blog transformation, auto-generate featured image based on post title + pillar
Prompt template in `config/prompts/featured_image.md` with style guidelines
userStories.notes: Uses Google Nano Banana Pro for professional AI-generated images

userStories.title: Featured Image Prompt Templates
userStories.description: As Joe, I want consistent image styles that match my brand.
acceptanceCriteria: Style: modern, clean, tech-focused, vibrant colors matching pillar
Each pillar has color palette guidance (purple for local-ai, blue for prompting, etc.)
Prompt includes: subject from title, pillar colors, 'professional tech blog style'
No text in images (clean visuals only)

userStories.title: Roundup Post Images
userStories.description: As Joe, I want unique featured images for roundup posts.
acceptanceCriteria: Roundup posts get distinct visual style (collage/mosaic feel)
Includes date range in composition (e.g., 'Jan 13-20' as subtle element)
Different style per pillar while maintaining cohesive brand

userStories.title: Image Generation API Config
userStories.description: As a developer, I want configurable image generation settings.
acceptanceCriteria: Config option: `image_provider: gemini` (extensible for future providers)
Fallback: if image generation fails, use placeholder and log warning
